question: In the given sequence of reactions, identify 'P, 'Q', 'R' and'S' respectively.
<katex>$CH_{2}=CH_{2} \xrightarrow{P} CH_{2}Br-CH_{2}Br \xrightarrow{Q} CH_{2}=CH-Br \xrightarrow{R} CH \equiv CH \xrightarrow{S} C_{6}H_{6}$</katex>
choices: HBr, Alc. KOH, <katex>$NaNH_{2}$</katex> Red hot iron tube
<katex>$Br_{2}$</katex>, Alc. KOH, <katex>$NaNH_{2}$</katex>, Red hot iron tube
explanation: P: Bromination. Q: Dehydrohalogenation (Partial). R: Dehydrohalogenation (Strong base for alkyne). S: Cyclic polymerization to Benzene.
